rows: assistiveText
Allows assistive text to be displayed below the input element.
autoFocus

If true, the input will be focused on the first render. No more than one element in the document or dialog may have the autofocus attribute. If applied to multiple elements the first one will receive focus. See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/autofocus) for more information.
autocomplete

Allows the user to enable or disable autocomplete functionality on the input field. See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete) for more information and values.
defaultValue
During a form reset, the default value will replace the current value. This prop is not normally needed.
disabled
When true, the user cannot edit or interact with the control.
inputmode

Provides a hint to browsers as to the type of virtual keyboard configuration to use when editing this element. See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#inputmode) for more information.
max
The maximum value of the input. Only applies when type is `number`. If the value provided is higher, the input is invalid.
maxlength
Maximum length (number of characters) of value. Only applies to types: `text`, `url`, `tel`, `email`, and `password`.
min
The minimum value of the input. Only applies when type is `number`. If the value provided is lower, the input is invalid.
minlength
Minimum length (number of characters) of value. Only applies to types: `text`, `url`, `tel`, `email`, and `password`.
name
The name of the input (used as a key/value pair with `value`). This is required in order to work properly with forms.
pattern
Specifies a regular expression the form control's value should match.
placeholder
The placeholder text to display when the input is empty. Only applies to types: `text`, `url`, `tel`, `email`, and `password`.
readonly
When true, the user cannot edit the control. Not the same as disabled. See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/readonly) for more information.
required

If true, the input is required to have a value before submitting the form. If there is no value, then the component validity state will be invalid. Important note: This will not prevent the form submission.
size
The size of the input field. Can be `small`, `medium`, or `large`. Defaults to `medium`.
status
The status of the input component / assistive text. If you use `status` you must provide an `assistiveText` prop value for accessibility purposes.
step
An optional amount that value should be incremented or decremented by when using the up and down arrows in the input. Only applies when type is `number`.
type
The type of HTML input to render.
value
The value of the input (used as a key/value pair in HTML forms with `name`).
